CytoDefiningCriteria: Appears as a parasagittal row of transversely oriented bipolar neurons in transverse sections of human
Medial superior olivary nucleus.EditorialNote: Someone had inserted nucleus laminaris as a synonym.  As that is in the avian brain, I hesitate to equate the two without further information.  I also don't believe that synonyms should be used to assert homology
Medial superior olivary nucleus.Definition: One of two subnuclei of the superior olive located within the caudal pontine tegmentum.  Appears as a parasagittal row of transversely oriented bipolar neurons in transverse sections of human, with elongated somata in humans and other primates and large caliber dendrites.
